text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the author has no statutory right to set or veto the public retail price and that authority lies with the publisher under France\u2019s fixed-price laws, citing an example like \u201cUnder the fixed-price system, the publisher\u2014not the author\u2014determines the public retail price.\u201d The candidate answer states, \"While the publisher usually sets the retail price, you can negotiate a minimum or maximum price,\" which contradicts the strict requirement that the authority lies solely with the publisher under fixed-price laws.
